page.title: 05LEISURE AND RECREATION (1)
page.content:
As Thorner is a relatively small village, the leisure opportunities are limited. There are tennis courts, a football pitch, allotments, a playground, riding stables, a cricket pitch, bowls and even a golf course closeby at Scarcroft. There is a Ladies Hockey club too.
Within the village itself the church tends to be the main focus.
There are several organizations specialising in local interest such as the Historical Society and the Village Society.
For those interested in music there are the church bell ringers, the Festival Chorus and junior choir as well as hand bell ringers. {more>>}
